title: Is it hard to learn to read and write if you’re 25 years old and have no education? - Quora

response.answer_text: People can learn at any age. It might be difficult to gt started, because people get scared to make mistakes, or they might feel ashamed they can’t read and write at that age, but the truth is it’s still possible to learn. What’s important though is to find a good mentor/facilitator. If the mentor(s) is helpful and give constructive feedback, learners can improve their skills quickly! But it’s important to start with small, achievable targets. Use SMART goals, to learn to read words, then short expressions, then short sentences, paragraphs, articles, etc. And later on when choosing books, they should be interesting yet not too overwhelming.

Thank you for the A2A. I think that with a little dedication and sincere intent, it is quite possible to learn anything no matter what the age. India has always encouraged more people to come forward and get educated. There are plenty of NGOs and governmental organizations that have pro-actively taken up the cause of ‘education for all’. In India, there is a separate Directorate for Adult Education in the Ministry of Human Resource Development.  Most of the people who come for these programs are fully grown adults. And they do get the basic idea of how to read and write and be relatively self-sufficient that way.
